definition: defensive line or perimeter/CL:道[dao4]
to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)
variant of 線|线[xian4]
psychological barrier
Siegfried Line, line of German military defenses during WWI and WWII

sentences.english: Drug and non-intravenous drug users in these two lines of defense is extremely fragile.
sentences.chinese: 戒毒和不静脉注射毒品这两道防线是极其脆弱的。

sentences.english: Marshalled by Ferdinand and Wes Brown, however, United's defence rarely creaked under the Latics' pressure.
sentences.chinese: 由于有费迪南德和布朗坐镇，曼联的防线还算稳固。

sentences.english: The British and American armies approached the Siegfried Line in September 1944.
sentences.chinese: 英美军队在1944年9月逼近齐格菲防线。

sentences.english: I have broken through your defenses, Leto.
sentences.chinese: 我穿透了你的防线，莱托。

sentences.english: The first protector against the entry of microorganisms is the integument .
sentences.chinese: 抗御微生物进入体内的第一道防线是皮肤。

sentences.english: Our defences rely on what we can plan and do now.
sentences.chinese: 我们的防线依赖于我们能计划和执行的措施。

sentences.english: They both have the ability and courage to attack defenders all the time.
sentences.chinese: 他们有能力和勇气在任何时候突破防线。

sentences.english: But, hopefully, after that he will restart his revered central defensive partnership with Nemanja Vidic for the run-in.
sentences.chinese: 但希望之后他能够与维迪奇合组防线搭档。

sentences.english: Our troops are already bursting through the enemy's weakened defences.
sentences.chinese: 我们的部人正在突破敌人防线中薄弱的环节。

sentences.english: They found it difficult to break through the enemy line.
sentences.chinese: 他们发现难以突破敌军防线。

sentences.english: The dynasty figure changes again and again, from the academy of Sung set out through the defense line of the gold.
sentences.chinese: 王朝背影频频换，从宋的书院出发经过了金的防线。

sentences.english: Our troops finally broke through enemy lines.
sentences.chinese: 我们的军队终于突破敌人防线。

sentences.english: This document will enable her to pass through the enemy lines unmolested.
sentences.chinese: 这证件将使她能平安无事地通过敌人防线。

sentences.english: There have been no reports of any coalition breaks through the Iraqi defenses in this area.
sentences.chinese: 没有联军在这一地区任何突破伊军防线的报道。

sentences.english: There should be at least two lines in each windbreak .
sentences.chinese: 在每个防风林中应该至少有两条防线。

sentences.english: After Yang Kunpeng absents , can the rear guard line need to transform greatly.
sentences.chinese: 杨鲲鹏缺席后，中能后防线需要大改造。

definition: the front line/the attack (e.g. football forwards)
to make a breakthrough/to break through/to breach (military)
formation (of a sports team, troops etc)
secure as a city protected by a wall of metal and a moat of boiling water (idiom)/well fortified/invulnerable to attack
to defend/to protect (against)
to attack violently/to storm
to check/to stop
to defeat/to smash/to rout
to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
to sally/to attack
battle line/battlefront/front
barrier
defense/to defend
to provide support/to come to the rescue
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
(of troops stationed in a strategic area) to defend/(fig.) to stand guard/to protect
